name: 1,1'-thiocarbonyldi-2(1h)-pyridone
Reason: 1,1'-thiocarbonyldi-2(1H)-pyridone has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The pyridine ring introduces rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at +20°C. The carbonyl group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The thiocarbonyl group introduces a sulfur atom, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, estimated at +30°C. The two additional phenyl groups can significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
